title: HDMS Thetis (F357)
text:
HDMS "Thetis" is a <a href="Thetis%20class%20ocean%20patrol%20vessels">"Thetis"-class</a> ocean patrol vessel belonging to the <a href="Royal%20Danish%20Navy">Royal Danish Navy</a>.
In mid-1990s the ship served as a platform for seismic operations in the waters near Greenland. In 2002 she took over the role from her sister ship <a href="HDMS%20Hvidbj%C3%B8rnen%20%28F360%29">"Hvidbjørnen"</a> as a platform for Commander Danish Task Group. The role was handed over to <a href="HDMS%20Absalon%20%28L16%29">"Absalon"</a> in September 2007. 
February - April 2008 "Thetis" served as a protection against <a href="Piracy%20off%20the%20coast%20of%20Somalia">pirates</a> for the <a href="World%20Food%20Programme">World Food Programme</a> chartered ships, carrying food aid, off the <a href="Horn%20of%20Africa">Horn of Africa</a>. A squad of soldiers from the <a href="Frogman%20Corps%20%28Denmark%29">Frogman Corps</a> was deployed aboard the ship.
In 2009 the ship served as staff ship for the NATO Mine Countermeasure Group 1.
